content: around 90 sts round 2 and following even-numbered rounds single_crochet around round 3 single_crochet in next 7 sts decrease around 80 sts round 5 single_crochet in next 6 sts decrease around 70 sts round 7 single_crochet in next 5 sts decrease around 60 sts round 9 single_crochet in next 4 sts decrease around 50 sts round 11 single_crochet in next 3 sts decrease around 40 sts round 13 single_crochet in next 2 sts decrease around 30 sts round 15 single_crochet decrease around 20 sts round 17 decrease around 10 sts murrell s row p 7 create button loop round 18 decrease decrease single_crochet ch15 skip 12 sts slip_stitch in bottom loop of next 3 chain sts single_crochet decrease decrease 6 sts break yarn fasten_off and use tail to close hole at top of crown you can adapt the button loop for a different-sized button by increasing or decreasing the number of skipped stitches try the button loop over your selected button as you work it finishing weave in ends soak hat in water for 20 minutes then press water out and roll in a hand towel to remove more excess water lay on a clean surface and gently smooth it flat leave it until it is completely dry to place button in correct location fold hat to 7 25 /18 5cm 8 /20 5cm 8 75 /22cm high use scrap yarn to attach the button to the center back weave in ends patch with smaller hook and selected patch color ch19 first row outward pass working into bottom loop of chain stitches pick up a loop in each stitch 20 loops on hook return pass ch1 then yarn over draw through two loops across 19 sts second row outward pass skip the first vertical bar at the beginning of the row insert hook into next vertical bar and draw up a loop continue drawing up a loop in each vertical bar across the row 20 loops on hook work a return pass to complete the row repeat the second row instructions until you have 26 row work a bind-off row by drawing up a loop in the second vertical bar from the hook and pulling it through the loop already on the hook repeat in each vertical bar across the row break yarn and fasten_off weave in ends and block the patch soak the patch in water for 20 minutes then press the water out and roll in a hand towel to remove more excess water lay a clean washcloth onto a surface that you can stick pins into such as a mattress carpet foam blocking tile or folded bath towel smooth the patch out on top of the washcloth use the pins to keep the patch s edges square and prevent them from rolling allow to dry completely murrell s row p 8 patch motif cut a piece of the motif color as long as your arm with a yarn needle beginning at the top left work a cross-stitch
